meanings.sent1: She was whidding through the crowd to catch the bus.
meanings.sent2: The squirrel was whidding up the tree to escape the dog.
meanings.sent3: The little mouse was whidding around the kitchen, looking for cheese.
meanings.sent4: Time was whidding by so fast, it felt like a blur.
meanings.sent5: The wind was whidding through the leaves, creating a soothing sound.

meanings.sent1: With a whidding, the car sped off into the distance.
meanings.sent2: The sudden whidding of the door made her jump.
meanings.sent3: The whidding of the roller coaster made her stomach flip.
meanings.sent4: The whidding of the clock's hands signaled the end of the day.
meanings.sent5: The whidding of the broom across the floor echoed in the empty room.
